action.action-desc: Mr. Honda introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs, and in addition to the Committees on Oversight and Government Reform and Armed Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To provide for cost-of-living increases for certain Federal benefits programs based on increases in the Consumer Price Index for the elderly.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
CPI–E Act of 2014
.

section.header: Cost-of-living increases for certain Federal benefits programs based on increases in the Consumer Price Index for the elderly
section.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, whenever there is an increase in the Consumer Price Index for the elderly, published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics, the dollar amounts in effect for the payment of the following benefits, as such amounts were in effect immediately before the increase in the Consumer Price Index for the elderly, shall be increased by the same percentage as such price index was increased:

paragraph.text: An annuity under the Civil Service Retirement System or the Federal Employees Retirement System.
Department of Veterans Affairs wartime disability compensation under section 1114 of title 38, United States Code.
Department of Veterans Affairs additional compensation for dependents under section 1115(1) of such title.
The Department of Veterans Affairs clothing allowance under section 1162 of such title.
Department of Veterans Affairs dependency and indemnity compensation to surviving spouse under subsections (a) through (d) of section 1311 of such title.
Department of Veterans Affairs dependency and indemnity compensation to children under sections 1313(a) and 1314 of such title.
Military retirement and survivor benefit programs, as defined in section 1461(b) of title 10, United States Code.
